Pages¶

Models¶

class PageManager¶

Custom filter methods related to the Page model.

active()¶

Return only active pages.

class Page(*args, **kwargs)¶

A Page is a collection of Modules with some extras

A Page has a title and is linked to the django.contrib.auth.User who created it through the user field. It knows whether it is active, visible, an example. It can have a token for sharing through a secret url.

It can contain any number of any type of modules, and has the ability to sort them by their position.

Module types:

  • pages.models.GeneralInfoModule
  • pages.models.CommunicationModule
  • pages.models.DoDontModule
  • pages.models.MedicationModule
  • pages.models.SensoryModule
  • pages.models.ContactModule
  • pages.models.FreeTextModule
  • pages.models.FreeListModule
  • pages.models.FreePictureModule
get_all_modules(**kwargs)¶

Returns a list of querysets, one per Module type. Kwargs will be passed to the filter method used to get the querysets.

get_all_modules_sorted¶

Returns a list of modules sorted by their position field.

module_deleted(position)¶

Handles cleanup when a Module is deleted.

Counts down the pages module number. Counts down the position of all the modules comming after this module.

make_token()¶

Returns a token that can be used to view the page until a new token is generated.

check_token(token)¶

Check that the token allows access to this page.

class Module(*args, **kwargs)¶

Abstract baseclass modules can inherit from. It has a ForeignKey relationship to pages.models:Page and a position field.

type¶

Returns the class name of an object in its original case.

delete_url_name¶

the url name including its namespace of this models delete page.

edit_url_name¶

the url name including its namespace of this models update page.

class GeneralInfoModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Module containing general information about the user. such as name, (autism related) identity, picture, …

Related to a pages.models.Page

identity field uses IDENTITIES as choices.

class CommunicationModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

This module contains communication suggestions, and can contain multiple pages.models.CommunicationMethods.

Related to a pages.models.Page

The suggestions_choices field uses SUGGESTIONS as choices.

class CommunicationMethods(*args, **kwargs)¶

CommunicationMethods belong to a pages.models.CommunicationModule. They describe prefered communication methods in two directions (‘me to you’ and ‘you to me’) for a certain situation.

The fields you_to_me_choices and me_to_you_choices both use METHODS as choices.

class DoDontModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Module containing lists of things to ‘do’, ‘ask first’ and ‘don’t do’.

Related to a pages.models.Page

do_choices field uses DOS as choices.

ask_choices field uses ASKS as choices.

dont_choices field uses DONTS as choices.

class MedicationModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

This module can contain multiple pages.models.MedicationItem.

Related to a pages.models.Page

class MedicationItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

MedicationItems belong to a pages.models.MedicationModule.

Each MedicationItem has a name, and a field for remarks

They can contain multiple pages.models.MedicationIntake, with further information.

They have a fixed position within the pages.models.MedicationModule, depending on the order they were added. This position is determined by the position field which is set automatically in the save method.

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

If creating

sets position field to the current maximum of positions within the pages.models:MedicationModule +1 and saves the object.

Else just save the object

class MedicationIntake(*args, **kwargs)¶

MedicationIntakes belong to a pages.models.MedicationItem.

Each MedicationIntake has a time and quantity

They have a fixed position within the pages.models.MedicationItem, depending on the order they were added. This position is determined by the position field which is set automatically in the save method.

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

If creating

sets position field to the current maximum of positions within the pages.models.MedicationItem +1 and saves the object.

Else just save the object

class SensoryModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Module containing sensory information. One can state how sensitive one is to sound, light, smell and temperature. On top of that further sensory information can be added.

Related to a pages.models.Page

sound, light, smell and temperature fields use RANGE as choices. extra_choices uses EXTRAS as choices

has_sensory_profile¶

Does the module have either of the following fields set: sound, light, smell, temperature.

class ContactModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

This module can contain multiple pages.models.ModuleContact.

Related to a pages.models.Page

class ModuleContact(*args, **kwargs)¶

ModuleContacts belong to a pages.models.ContactModule. They have a title, name, address, phone, email, and extra field.

class FreeTextModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Module for saving free text with a title.

Related to a pages.models.Page

class FreeListModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Module for saving a list of items with a title.

Related to a pages.models.Page

class FreePictureModule(*args, **kwargs)¶

This module has a title field and can contain multiple pages.models.ModulePicture.

Related to a pages.models.Page

class ModulePicture(*args, **kwargs)¶

ModulePictures belong to a pages.models.PictureModule. They have a title, description and picture.

Views¶

class PageCreateAccessMixin¶

LoginRequired, but instead of redirecting to login, redirect to register.

class PageCreateView(**kwargs)¶

CreateView that allows a user to create a page and add a first module.

Before saving the page is connected to the creating django.contrib.auth.User (login required). And the user is redirected to create page of the module they have selected in the form.

form_class

PageCreateForm

Context

object
An instance of pages.models.Page.

Template:

:template:`pages/createpage.html`.

model¶

alias of Page

class PageDeleteView(**kwargs)¶

DeleteView that asks the user to confirm that he wants to delete this page.

To access this view the user must be the owner of the page.

Context

object
An instance of pages.models.Page.
modules
a sorted list of modules belonging to this page.

Template:

:template:`pages/deletepage.html`.

model¶

alias of Page

class SelectModuleView(**kwargs)¶

UpdateView to edit page and add new modules.

To access this view the user must be the owner of the page.

Depending on the submit button used the user is redirected:

  • either to the create page of the module they have selected in the form.
  • or to ModuleSortView.

form_class

AddModuleForm

Context

object
An instance of pages.models.Page.
modules
A sorted list of modules belonging to this page.

Template:

:template:`pages/createpage.html`.

model¶

alias of Page

class ModuleCreateView(**kwargs)¶

Baseview for creating a module. Can be subclassed by most modulecreateviews.

get_context_data(**kwargs)¶

Add the page to the context explicitly. Add form_context: create to the context so that we can use one template but still differentiate between create and update cases.

form_valid(form)¶

Set the page foreignkey of the newly created model. Update the number of modules in the page. Give the module the next available position. Make sure to not create a module if the form was left empty.

test_func()¶

Access test: Only the owner of the page can create modules for it.

class FormsetModuleCreateView(*args, **kwargs)¶

Baseview for creating a module using a formset for a Foreignkey linked model. Can be subclassed by modulecreateviews needing to use a formset.

get_context_data(**kwargs)¶

adds the formset to the context.

form_valid(form)¶

takes care of saving the formset.
